page.title: 07NEWTOWN PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Newtown School was built in 1851 at a cost of Â£120, the school house was added in 1853 (Â£170), and a second classroom was added in 1871. Two temporary classrooms have recently been added, only one class is still taught in the old building.The house, not used by the present Headteacher, is used for a variety of activities. As a village school its pupils ages ranged from 4 to 13 years. It was used for meetings,concerts and as a Polling Station. After the 1944 Education Act it became a Primary School and since 1958 has pupils up to age 8 only. 100 years ago parents were in farming occupations or providing services, now the vast majority of parents are professional or naval personnel. Five families are connected with farming including a vine grower.
